  • Method Details

    • addItem

      public void addItem(int slot, Inventory.Item item)
      Description copied from interface: InventoryKernel
      Adds the Item item to this at slot. If the same Item is at the destination, they are stacked (their count is summed). The destination slot must be empty or hold an Item with the same name. The Item must satisfy the tag restrictions imposed by this. Note that stacking Items of the same name will add the tags of item to the existing Item at dest. If the Item at dest already has that tag, its tag value will be overwritten.
      Parameters:
      slot - the slot at which to add the Item
      item - the item to add at the destination

    • removeItem

      public Inventory.Item removeItem(int slot)
      Description copied from interface: InventoryKernel
      Remove the Item at slot. Will return an empty Item if that slot is empty.
      Parameters:
      slot - the position at which to remove an Item
      Returns:
      the Item at slot

    • restrict

      public ArrayList<Inventory.Item> restrict(String tag)
      Description copied from interface: InventoryKernel
      Requires Items that are added to this to have tag tag and returns existing Items without tag tag.
      Parameters:
      tag - the tag to require
      Returns:
      the Items currently in this that do not have tag as a tag

    • freeRestrictions

      public void freeRestrictions()
      Description copied from interface: InventoryKernel
      Removes all tag restrictions from this.

    • isAllowed

      public boolean isAllowed(Inventory.Item item)
      Description copied from interface: InventoryKernel
      Checks whether an Item passes the tag restrictions to be added to this.
      Parameters:
      item - the Item to check against the restrictions
      Returns:
      true if item passes intake restrictions, and false otherwise

    • nextIndexOf

      public int nextIndexOf(String name, int pos)
      Description copied from interface: InventoryKernel
      Returns position of the first slot in the Inventory after position pos at which an Item called name exists.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the item to find
      pos - the starting position
      Returns:
      the index of the first such slot, or -1 if there are none
